comment: Pay attention to the lecture, read the material, do the labs and (if you understand programming in general) you'll get an A. The professor was very willing to spend extra time on difficult concept.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Mora is a new professor at Kennesaw State this semester, he does have an accent but after a while, you will get used to it. He cares about students and wants them to do well in the course, and in our class attendance was extra credit so be sure to attend every class. I have learned a great deal about Java and programming with Java.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Not clear on what he wants on assignments does not have a designated Lab time which is quite bad since he had the class for 2 hours with no lab time to reinforce what we learned on a weekly basis. Final is nothing like first two exams, said he would curve but Final Grades were not posted yet even though even tho today is the deadline for Final Grades.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Cepeda Mora lacks the ability to teach programming. The code he distributes for assignments is messy and old. His instructions are very vague and unclear. During lectures, he talks slightly above a whisper and doesn't seem to grasp the concepts he is teaching enough to explain them adequately, leaving his students frustrated and confused.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He tries his hardest to teach the class but his code that he uses for examples won't even compile.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Carlos both misspells and miswords instructions on labs. You will be extremely confused if you aren't a natural coder and extremely annoyed if you are.
